messages.message: I’ve added initial results for low-light pedestrian detection with the adjusted preprocessing pipeline. The improvement in recall is about 10%, but false positives remain high.
Do the false positives tend to cluster in any particular scenarios, like near intersections or parked vehicles?
Mostly near intersections with complex backgrounds. I’ll focus on these cases for the next round of debugging.
I’ve uploaded a detailed analysis of crosswalk detection inconsistencies to Notion: https://notion.nvidia.com/crosswalk-detection-report. Feedback welcome.
Thermal imaging integration tests show improved accuracy for hidden pedestrians, but latency has increased. Could we explore hardware-specific optimizations?
We could consider offloading some preprocessing to edge devices. I’ll test this with the current pipeline.
Sounds good. Let me know if you need additional data for these tests.
The QA team flagged inconsistencies in pedestrian bounding boxes during sharp turns. This might be related to the camera calibration settings.
Do we have calibration logs from the latest camera setup?
Yes, I’ll upload the calibration logs and share the link shortly.
The current model is struggling with partially occluded pedestrians near delivery trucks. Should we prioritize adding more occlusion data?
Yes, and we should also consider augmenting the dataset with varying truck sizes and positions.
I’ve scheduled a QA session to validate shadow detection issues. Please send specific scenarios that need testing by end of day.
I’ll add examples with dynamic shadows caused by moving vehicles.
We’re seeing detection drops in rural environments where pedestrians are far from the roadside. Should we tweak the detection range?
That could work. I’ll analyze the current range thresholds and propose adjustments.
The fog simulation results are in. Accuracy improved by 12% after dataset augmentation, but edge cases remain in dense fog.
Let’s refine the augmentation pipeline to include varying fog densities.
I’ve drafted a Confluence page with findings from the latest suburban trials: https://confluence.nvidia.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=902344.
Thanks, Samantha. I’ll review and add notes on how different vehicle speeds impacted detection.
